result.execSummary:
The defendant Thaddeus W Beachem was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
AMENDED 10-26-2021:  Extended supervision modified per stipulation by the parties.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 10 years bifurcated sentence.  

AMENDED 03-07-2019 to include CFTS that is to be applied to initial confinement
Consecutive to: any other sentence, but concurrent to Counts 2 & 3.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with A.H..  Comply with Child Support Orders.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence, but concurrent to Counts 2 & 3.

AMENDED 10-26-2021:  Extended supervision modified per stipulation by the parties.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 10 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: any other sentence, but concurrent to Counts 1 & 3.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions are as outlined in Count 1.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence, but concurrent to Counts 1 & 3.

Defendant Thaddeus W Beachem in court with attorney Joshua Hargrove.  Defendant Thaddeus W Beachem in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Thaddeus W Beachem in court with attorney Erin Joy Larsen.  Defendant Thaddeus W Beachem in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
